001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
004
005import java.util.HashMap;
006import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
007import java.util.Map;
008import java.util.Set;
009import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
010
011import com.technototes.library.general.Periodic;
012import com.technototes.library.structure.CommandOpMode;
013import com.technototes.library.subsystem.Subsystem;
014
015/**
016 * This is a "singleton" object.
017 * <p>
018 * TODO: The "CommandScheduler.getInstance()" thing is really kinda silly. Perhaps it's how WPIlib
019 * TODO: works, but it's clunky and makes things messier for non-FRC programmers. I think I'm going
020 * TODO: yoink that method and make static methods for next year's release...
021 */
022public final class CommandScheduler {
023
024    private final Map<Command, BooleanSupplier> commandMap;
025    private final Map<Subsystem, Set<Command>> requirementMap;
026    private final Map<Subsystem, Command> defaultMap;
027
028    private final Set<Periodic> registered;
029
030    private CommandOpMode opMode;
031
032    /**
033     * Set the scheduler's opmode
034     *
035     * @param c the opmode
036     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
037     */
038    public CommandScheduler setOpMode(CommandOpMode c) {
039        opMode = c;
040        return this;
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Forcefully halt the opmode
045     *
046     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
047     */
048    public CommandScheduler terminateOpMode() {
049        opMode.terminate();
050        return this;
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Gets the number of seconds that the opmode has been executing
055     *
056     * @return elapsed time since opmode was started, in seconds
057     */
058    public double getOpModeRuntime() {
059        return opMode.getOpModeRuntime();
060    }
061
062    // The Singleton CommandScheduler
063    private static CommandScheduler instance;
064
065    /**
066     * Get (or create) the singleton CommandScheduler object
067     *
068     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton
069     */
070    public static synchronized CommandScheduler getInstance() {
071        if (instance == null) {
072            instance = new CommandScheduler();
073        }
074        return instance;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Alex had a comment "be careful with this" and he's not wrong.
079     * This removes the old Singleton and creates a new one. That's pretty dangerous...
080     *
081     * @return a *new* singleton object (which makes very little sense)
082     */
083    public static synchronized CommandScheduler resetScheduler() {
084        instance = null;
085        Command.clear();
086        return getInstance();
087    }
088
089    private CommandScheduler() {
090        commandMap = new HashMap<>();
091        requirementMap = new HashMap<>();
092        defaultMap = new HashMap<>();
093        registered = new LinkedHashSet<>();
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * Schedule a command to run
098     *
099     * @param command the command to schedule
100     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
101     */
102    public CommandScheduler schedule(Command command) {
103        return schedule(command, () -> true);
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Schedule a command to run
108     *
109     * @param command the command to schedule
110     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
111     */
112    public CommandScheduler scheduleOnce(Command command) {
113        return schedule(command);
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Schedule a command to run during a particular OpModeState
118     *
119     * @param command the command to schedule
120     * @param state   the state during which the command should be scheduled
121     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
122     */
123    public CommandScheduler scheduleOnceForState(Command command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState state) {
124        return scheduleForState(command, state);
125    }
126
127    public CommandScheduler scheduleInit(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
128        return scheduleForState(command, supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.INIT);
129    }
130
131    public CommandScheduler scheduleInit(Command command) {
132        return scheduleForState(command, () -> true, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.INIT);
133    }
134
135    public CommandScheduler scheduleJoystick(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
136        return scheduleForState(command, supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.END);
137    }
138
139    public CommandScheduler scheduleJoystick(Command command) {
140        return scheduleForState(command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.END);
141    }
142
143    public CommandScheduler scheduleForState(
144            Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState... states) {
145        return schedule(
146                command.cancelUpon(() -> !opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)),
147                () -> supplier.getAsBoolean() && opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states));
148    }
149
150    public CommandScheduler scheduleForState(Command command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState... states) {
151        return schedule(
152                command.cancelUpon(() -> !opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)),
153                () -> opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states));
154    }
155
156    public CommandScheduler scheduleAfterOther(Command dependency, Command other) {
157        return schedule(other, dependency::justFinishedNoCancel);
158    }
159
160    public CommandScheduler scheduleWithOther(Command dependency, Command other) {
161        return schedule(other, dependency::justStarted);
162    }
163
164    public CommandScheduler scheduleAfterOther(Command dependency, Command other, BooleanSupplier additionalCondition) {
165        return schedule(other, () -> dependency.justFinishedNoCancel() && additionalCondition.getAsBoolean());
166    }
167
168    public CommandScheduler scheduleWithOther(Command dependency, Command other, BooleanSupplier additionalCondition) {
169        return schedule(other, () -> dependency.justStarted() && additionalCondition.getAsBoolean());
170    }
171
172    public CommandScheduler scheduleDefault(Command command, Subsystem subsystem) {
173        if (command.getRequirements().contains(subsystem)) {
174            defaultMap.put(subsystem, command);
175            schedule(command, () -> getCurrent(subsystem) == command);
176        } else {
177            System.err.println("default commands must require their subsystem: "
178                    + command.getClass().toString());
179        }
180        return this;
181    }
182
183    public CommandScheduler register(Periodic p) {
184        registered.add(p);
185        return this;
186    }
187
188    @Nullable public Command getDefault(Subsystem s) {
189        return opMode.getOpModeState() == CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN ? defaultMap.get(s) : null;
190    }
191
192    @Nullable public Command getCurrent(Subsystem s) {
193        if (requirementMap.get(s) == null) return null;
194        for (Command c : requirementMap.get(s)) {
195            if (c.isRunning()) return c;
196        }
197        return getDefault(s);
198    }
199
200    public CommandScheduler schedule(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
201        commandMap.put(command, supplier);
202        for (Subsystem s : command.getRequirements()) {
203            requirementMap.putIfAbsent(s, new LinkedHashSet<>());
204            requirementMap.get(s).add(command);
205            register(s);
206        }
207        return this;
208    }
209
210    public void run() {
211        // For each newly scheduled command,
212        // cancel any existing command that is using the new command's subsystem requirements
213        commandMap.forEach((c1, b) -> {
214            if (c1.justStarted()) {
215                for (Subsystem s : c1.getRequirements()) {
216                    for (Command c2 : requirementMap.get(s)) {
217                        if (c1 != c2) {
218                            c2.cancel();
219                        }
220                    }
221                }
222            }
223        });
224        commandMap.forEach((c1, b) -> {
225            if (b.getAsBoolean() || c1.isRunning()) {
226                c1.run();
227            }
228        });
229        registered.forEach(Periodic::periodic);
230    }
231}
